keyTakeAways: Lance Bass has type 1.5 diabetes, also known as latent autoimmune diabetes of adulthood (LADA).
Bass uses the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System to manage his blood sugar levels.
He created an online persona called 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate the public about diabetes with humor, which developed accidentally during social media use.
He notes that certain foods, especially white rice and white bread, cause significant blood sugar spikes, even with insulin use.
Bass previously struggled with diabetes management, having to leave blood sugar testing at home in the past.
His uncle had type 1 diabetes, which influenced his early awareness of the condition.
He credits modern monitoring technology and the supportive diabetic community for improving his quality of life.
Stress from his busy career and parenting his four-year-old twins affects his blood sugar levels.
Bass has no current plans for an *NSYNC reunion tour and has dismissed recent claims about such a reunion as misinformation.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Lance Bass, former member of the boy band *NSYNC, shares personal insights into managing type 1.5 diabetes (LADA), emphasizing how modern technology like the Dexcom G7 device and social media presence—particularly through his humorous online persona 'Blood Sugar Lance'—have improved his daily life. He highlights that certain foods like white rice and white bread cause dangerous blood sugar spikes, and he attributes his current success in managing the condition to advancements in monitoring and community support. Despite fan speculation about a possible *NSYNC reunion, Bass has no current plans and dismisses such rumors as misinformation. His experience reflects broader public interest in diabetes awareness, personal health transparency, and the role of technology in chronic disease management.
title: Lance Bass has more to say about living with diabetes than he does about an *NSYNC reunion
